subject: Sleep
title: Sleepwalking Explained
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Sleepwalking Explained.

hook.text: A teenager walks downstairs, opens the fridge, eats cold pizza, and returns to bed. He remembers nothing.

buildup.text: Sleepwalking is a parasomnia, an unwanted behavior that occurs during partial arousal from deep sleep.

discovery.text: The brain is caught between N3 and wakefulness. Motor circuits wake up but consciousness stays asleep.

twist.text: Contrary to myth, it is safe to wake a sleepwalker. They'll be confused but not harmed.

climax.text: Sleepwalking is most common in children and usually disappears by adolescence as deep sleep decreases.

punchline.text: Sleepwalking is a body on autopilot with no one in the cockpit.

quiz.question: During which sleep stage does sleepwalking occur?
